title: Did Mitch McConnell say that one of his proud moments was saying to Obama, "You're not gonna fill this vacancy in the Supreme Court?"
subtitle: Mimi contrasted with the statements made by the President of the Majority of the Senate, Mitch McConnell, about the Senate's duty to confirm the Supreme Court's nominations.
author: David Emery
vclaim: In 2016, the majority leader of the Senate, Mitch McConnell, said: "One of my proudest moments was when I said to Obama, "This vacancy in the Supreme Court will not be filled," and in 2017, he said, "It is clear that there is a new standard now, namely that the Supreme Court candidate will never be confirmed. I think this is something the American people will simply not bear."
